abstract: Infosys’s contract to handle all Microsoft’s technology services and support begs the question: can’t Microsoft get its own technology to work by itself?
snippet: Infosys’s contract to handle all Microsoft’s technology services and support begs the question: can’t Microsoft get its own technology to work by itself?
lead_paragraph: Infosys, a big outsourcing company based in India, got a nice win on Tuesday, grabbing a three-year contract to handle all the technology services and support for Microsoft itself.

abstract: The data recovery industry received a bit of a jolt this week when Double-Take Software disclosed that an unidentified suitor had made an unsolicited offer to buy it for a premium price.
snippet: The data recovery industry received a bit of a jolt this week when Double-Take Software disclosed that an unidentified suitor had made an unsolicited offer to buy it for a premium price.
lead_paragraph: The data recovery industry received a bit of a jolt this week when Double-Take Software disclosed that an unidentified bidder had made an unsolicited offer to buy it for a premium price. Double-Take’s stock jumped about 20 percent on Monday on anticipation that a larger company was eager to acquire Double-Take’s technology to add data recovery to its list of services.

headline.main: For Tech Bidders, Data Recovery Seems Alluring
